newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada trade minister to meet U.S. counterpart.
newsitem.headline: Canada trade minister to meet U.S. counterpart.

text.p: Canada's new trade minister, Sergio Marchi, plans to meet with his U.S. counterpart Charlene Barshefsky this week to discuss bilateral free trade and expansion of the World Trade Organization, the Canadian government said on Monday.

The ministers from the world's biggest trading partnership will meet in Washington on Wednesday to discuss the North American Free Trade Agreement and the Free Trade Area of the Americas, Marchi said in a statement.
The two trade representatives also planned to discuss the expansion of the World Trade Organization to include Russia and China, he said.
"It's a get-to-know-you session on both sides," Marchi's spokeswoman said in a telephone interview.
The United States and Canada are each other's biggest trade partner.
